title: save_html() - UnicodeEncodeError with Force Plot (Partial Solution Found)
body:
Hi,

I've been trying to use the save_html() function to save a force plot returned from DeepExplainer. 
I have no problem saving the plot as such:
 `plot =shap.force_plot(
                    explainer.expected_value[0],
                    shap_values[0][0], features = original_feature_values,
                    feature_names= feature_names)`
It produces an ipython HTML object as expected.

However when I call `shap.save_html('explainer.html', plot)` on it I get the following error `UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u0100' in position 34699: character maps to <undefined>`

I looked into the error and it's usually the result of not explicitly encoding characters as 'utf-8' .
I went through the code in force.py and into the `save_html()` function on line 217 and found by changing the following:
`if type(out_file) == str:
        out_file = open(out_file, "w")
        internal_open = True
    out_file.write("<html><head><script>\n")`
on line 222 to:
`      if type(out_file) == str:
        out_file = open(out_file, "w",encoding='utf-8')
        internal_open = True
    out_file.write("<html><head><script>\n")`
I can get it to work again. 

This is has solved the error for me and the `explainer.html` file is now being generated, however I think this is only a partial solution as the force plot is rendering somewhat incorrectly (see the attached image) 
![Capture_new](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8831892/60099460-97699380-974f-11e9-9b65-bf6d412d57b2.PNG)

Any thoughts on what might be going on here ? Thanks.
